instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165A backlight issue
threads.message: Image is present, O/P voltage is very inconsistent (I mean fluctuating between 25 and 8.5V) Indeed the backlight also fluctuates, It's not staying a long time for more than 25V.

threads.title: 820-00165A backlight issue
threads.message:
25V is the correct voltage there.
If drops, possibly corrosion under U7701, or surrounding resistors.

Just in case, did you test with known good screen?

threads.title: 820-00165A backlight issue
threads.message:
I have changed u7701 , still backlight is not staying … 
I don’t have a working lcd to test… is there a way I can make sure the current lcd is good?

threads.title: 820-00165A backlight issue
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 87886, member: 682"]
DP_INT_HPD is steady high?
[/QUOTE]
It is steady and 2.681V

threads.title: 820-00165A backlight issue
threads.message:
Did you check the basics?
XW7720 is OK?

threads.title: 820-00165A backlight issue
threads.message:
BKL_EN/PWM both stable?
If all components are good, then bad LCD...
